extendedInfo.description: Conflicts: Operation Barbarossa is a highly rated turn based strategy game which takes place on the Eastern Front during the Second World War. You are in the command of the German WWII armed forces - tanks, infantry and air force units - and the object of the game is to conquer the Soviet Union as quickly as possible. To have a chance to seize the top spot in the Hall of Fame you need to skillfully encircle scores of Red Army infantry units with your panzers, while battling both the feared T-34 tank units and the notorious Russian weather. FEATURES:+ Historical accuracy: Campaign mirrors the historical setup.+ Long-lasting: Thanks to in-built variation and the game's smart AI technology, each game provides a unique war gaming experience.+ Competitive: Measure your strategy game skills against others fighting for the Hall of Fame top spots.+ Supports casual play: Easy to pick up, leave off, continue later.+ Challenging: Crush your enemy quickly and earn the bragging rights on the forum.+ Reinforcements and replacement units, plus new unit types - like Tiger I tanks - if the war lasts several years.+ Experienced units learn new skills, like improved attack or defense performance, extra move points, damage resistance, ability to cross rivers without losing move points, etc.+ Settings: Various settings to alter the look of the gaming experience: different icon sets for units (real - NATO - web 2.0), difficulty levels, etc.+ A large range of WWII units under your command: tanks, infantry, motorized infantry, weak Axis infantry, Waffen SS troops, the German air force and espionage units. Meanwhile, the Red Army starts with weaker infantry, cavalry and tank units, but as the weeks pass, is reinforced with stronger Siberian and T-34 tank units.+ Weather modelling: Spring/autumn mud slows movement, while winter reduces line-of-sight and freezing cold hampers units, especially mechanized ones.+ Tablet friendly strategy game: Automatically scales the map for any physical screen size/resolution from small smartphones to HD tablets, while settings allow you to fine tune hexagon and font sizes.+ Inexpensive: The entire WWII eastern front for the price of a coffee!In order to be a victorious general, you must learn to coordinate your attacks in two ways. First, as adjacent units give support to an attacking unit, keep your units in groups in order to gain local superiority. Secondly, it is rarely the best idea to use brute force when it is possible to encircle the enemy and cut off its supply lines instead.One of the compliments that this wargame has received is that many users have compared it to the classic  strategic board games by Avalon Hill and GMT.If you want to test this WWII game, a LITE version is available for free. It includes all the features, but the game will stop after you reach over 30 VPs.Answer the call of duty and join Conflict series on Facebook or Google+!+ http://on.fb.me/wsC2QV+ http://bit.ly/GHHGU1Join your fellow strategy gamers in changing the course of the Second World War!The list below includes the permissions requested and the reasons for their use.+ Internet: To fetch Hall of Fame data from a server.+ Network State: To determine if you are online so the game doesn't crash while trying to connect.+ Control Vibrator: To vibrate the phone during the battles.

reviews.title: Great game
reviews.comment: One of my favourite pass times on my phone. Frustrating some times but war isn\'t supposed to be easy.  10/10 from me.
reviews.author: Allan Stott

reviews.title: New update too unrealistic
reviews.comment: How can the enemy field 100 infantry units?  How about a max on the nunber of enemy units generated.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great game. Great value.
reviews.comment: This is the real thing: a classic WW2 hex wargame that offers a good challenge and will take several hours. Well done!
reviews.author: Scott Szczypiorski

reviews.comment: Fun, addictive, ... Good quotes...
reviews.author: J Johnson

reviews.title: Amazing game!
reviews.comment: Captures the feel of the campaign amazingly well. Does a great job of handling weather, supply, fatigue, etc.  Honestly would be a steal at triple the price.
reviews.author: Grant Trew

reviews.title: Great game
reviews.comment: Just like the old SSI board games of my youth.  It is refreshing to find a strategy game that makes you think and plan ahead like chess.  This is not a new shooting game which is why I love it.  Easy to learn and it runs well on my Samsung Galaxy 4 phone.  The author does have more complex games if you prefer more detail and hands on control of the action.  The author does respond to suggestions, questions or problems in a timely manner.  If you want to command an army this is for you.
reviews.author: Ron Thompson

reviews.title: Cool game, UI needs overhaul
reviews.comment: It\'s like chess, with tanks! My only gripe is the UI, which is prone to causing you to misclick and move units to places you don\'t want them when trying to dismiss the action report after a battle.
reviews.author: David Fox

reviews.comment: Another excellent game from Joni.  I like how all Conflicts games are continuously being refined and updated.  For one very small price, you get a game that is constantly improving.
reviews.author: John Parrish

reviews.comment: Awesome historical strategy game
reviews.author: Ryan Irvine

reviews.title: Excellent game
reviews.comment: Brilliant!  wish more tank variants, but overall, very addictive.
reviews.author: Ian Barnes

reviews.title: A real challange
reviews.comment: Great game that can be very frustrating. Design leads game play into  realistic scenarios. Would like to see the option on your games to play the other side either built into the each present game or as a new issue. I like to whip up on the Germans sometimes also. Would also like a PC version of your games to play at home on my laptop. Jim
reviews.author: Jim McLaughlin

reviews.title: Outstanding game and great support!
reviews.comment: I love Operation Barbarossa, since it successfully transforms the complexity of desktop strategy games to the Android level. Managed to solve on normal difficulty, but harder levels remain very challenging.  My technical issue was consequently investigated by the developer and resolved within hours. Awesome and definitely a recommendation!
reviews.author: Johannes Schleehauf

reviews.title: Outstanding!
reviews.comment: Beware! This game will drain your battery completely... Because you CANNOT stop playing, it is THAT good =) Seriously, I come home with a flat tablet now. I wish this was on pc, too, so I can keep playing while my tablet is docked =D
reviews.author: Niels Toft Larsen

reviews.title: Fabulous!
reviews.comment: A masterpiece for Android format. Like others, couldnt put it down, into the wee small hours, yet you can easily play in small chunks and return to it also. This developer really knows what he\'s doing and historical attention to detail is all there. Will certainly be looking at all the others in series. Excellent value for money with hours of gameplay.
reviews.author: Les Peppiatt

reviews.title: Outstanding!!!
reviews.comment: Finally, the Avalon Hill and GMT Games tradition comes to my smartphone.  All hail Joni Nuutinen!!!
reviews.author: Chip Stockton

reviews.title: Highly addictive
reviews.comment: Enough said, really. Still hooked even tho i\'ve changed history several times now
reviews.author: Nicholas Allen

reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment: Great addictive game
reviews.author: Kishore K

reviews.title: No \"undo\" and cheating AI will ruin your day
reviews.comment: Joni replied that there are many reasons for the lack of an \"undo\" function, chief one being cheaters using it to get ahead in the Hall of Fame (HoF). He claimed this has happened in earlier games. The additional memory could also crash older versions of Android. To avoid careless fingers, he suggested changing to a bigger hex size, and set \"Misclick prevention\" to \"Very aggressive\". The game will supposedly ignore any touch between 2 hexes in this setting. However, after playing for a month, I found there is hardly any difference in the setting changes; it is still too easy to tap the wrong hex when moving or selecting units. Personally, I would gladly be barred from any HoF standing in return for an \"undo\", but since this is a major attraction of the game, I can understand his reluctance to change this feature. The ridiculous battle results that happen often is less easy to overlook. I do not know how results are calculated, but the frequency in which the AI beat the odds led me to suspect it\'s more than just a \'bad roll of the dice\'. Difficult is one thing, but having your careful planning thwarted time and again by a cheating AI is another. Buy if you enjoy pulling at your hair
reviews.author: Kah Choon Chan

reviews.title: Excellent game for tablet
reviews.comment: Like others have mentioned, there is room for improvement. Still an excellent game, hard (yes the AI cheats, especially when cornered and unending USSR units) and will rob you of hours and hours!  :-)
reviews.author: stewart guenther

reviews.title: Jacob the Elder
reviews.comment: Achtung! For those who don\'t want to spend hours (days? Months?) addicted to an excellent, well thought out and executed turn-based strat, don\'t buy this game. Purchased last October and it has played hell with my ability to study. It\'s easy to get the hang of the mechanics, takes hours to master (check the HOF: top players are able to crush it in,  what.  40 turns? Personal best is under 100 but wow.). So fun! Group your units, hit hard where the enemy is weakest. Good luck.
reviews.author: Jacob Dwyer
